channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024081608
item.description:
Report X-2024081608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA with visible leakage and a strong odor. Upon further inspection it is revealed that the drum had a loose lid/ seal failure leading to the spill, we believed it to be non hazardous at first. We had to reach out to the shipper to get the SDS which caused the initial delay in the DPR, however when provided the transport section did not have any information about it being hazardous, but we suspected it being hazardous because of the SDS chemical composition as well as the GHS classifications listed. We processed the DPR and ISF and asked for an updated SDS from the shipper and the delay from then to filling out an incident report was because the shipper sent us an SDS with the transport information today, however the SDS itself seems to have some conflicting items as it is classified as non hazardous but a UN#, class, as well as packing group were provided right below , it also has acute toxicity NFPA label and a skull and crossbones GHS label but no other information in the transport section about them. The proper shipping name I entered is what I found on the ERG however one was not provided on the SDS. I will include both SDS's for reference.

item.title: Report E-2024080557
item.description:
Report E-2024080557

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 19, 2024, at 1617 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Union Gap, Washington regarding the release of Transchem Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 2 gallons of Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid Solution, 8, II) from a box containing (4) 1-gallon plastic pails. The release was due to a load shift and impacted a 6ft x 6ft area on the trailer floor and the outer boxes of other cargo. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Thirty-four 1-gallon plastic pails of recovered product were collected and containerized in (2) 55-gallon DFâ€™s. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 55-gallon DF, then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081341
item.description:
Report X-2024081341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE ( GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB AND DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment moved from PDX to SEA via RFS. FTRs cancelled, tried to move on PAX plane, screening was needed. Found during Xray. Undeclared DG found in Shipment. AWB 72344871. PVC Cement UN1133 Adhesive x 8 ounces

item.title: Report X-2024081189
item.description:
Report X-2024081189

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was found by the morning sort as an unprocessed hazmat originating from another station. While attempting to process it they realized it was missing the 1.4 diamond placard. There was no damage to the contents or package it just doesn't have the diamond label. Since it is not compliant do to the lack of the hazard class diamond and we are not the origin station we are not able to process this package.

item.title: Report X-2024081029
item.description:
Report X-2024081029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA with visible leakage and a strong odor. Upon further inspection it is revealed that one of the caps on a bottle had come loose causing it to spill. We believe this to be undeclared as the SDS and the percentage given on the package marks it as limited quantity but there were no ground limited quantity marks visible on the package and nothing to indicate it in FTrack.
